New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history to post at least 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a single season.
Shohei Ohtani became the only player in Dodgers history to record 10 RBIs in a single game.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit three home runs against the Miami Marlins.
Ohtani scored his 50th stolen base of the season.
Ohtani hit a two-RBI double in the third inning.
Ohtani hit a 438-foot home run in the sixth inning.
Ohtani hit his second home run of the night in the seventh inning.
Ohtani hit a three-run home run in the ninth inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers clinched a postseason bid following their 20-4 win, improving to a 91-62 record on the season.
